Risk‑free U.S. Treasury bills have which beta under CAPM, and why?
</strong>
<label><input type="radio" name="module3_mcq_q72" value="A"> A. Beta = 1, because they move with the market portfolio.</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module3_mcq_q72" value="B"> B. Beta > 0, since they have small inflation risk.</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module3_mcq_q72" value="C"> C. Beta < 0, since they hedge market downturns.</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module3_mcq_q72" value="D"> D. Beta = 0, since their returns are uncorrelated with the market.</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module3_mcq_q72" value="E"> E. Beta undefined, since they are riskless.</label><br>
